p: The phytochemical constituents of the essential oils under investigation include many of the most active naturally existing anticancer phytochemicals, such as 1, 8-cineole and linalool [ 23â€“ 25]. Similarly, polyphenols, such as quercetin, are often reported to exert anticancer activities against various cancer cell lines [ 25]. Remarkably, the numerous phytochemical constituents in essential oils and their potency to prevent cancer cell growth at fairly low concentrations may be attributed to the additive or synergistic effects of the different components.
